reviews.review_msg: Professor Nye was fantastic! I loved her class, she teaches about important and thought-provoking topics. She gives a lot of free reign when it comes to paper/projects which is nice because you can put time/effort into topics that you find interesting. A relatively easy and fair marker as long as you can show the time/effort/thought you put in!

Love Elle! It is always nice to listen to her lectures. She is very caring and approachable. She values participation and her lectures are engaging. There is some homework and more writing but she is a fair grader and accommodating. Will definitely take another class with her!

The homework that she gives is not too hard but there is a lot of homework. She gave us an activity, discussion question, discussion response, and journal almost every week and it was difficult to keep up with all the little assignments on top of all my other courses. She gave fair grades though and allowed things to be handed in a day late.
Had a class about fitness culture. She is super nice and caring when it comes to helping you out to get a better mark. Her lectures are very engaging and she is very funny.

all she does is play videos in class and give really bad mark on assignments with little to no feedback, her office hours are not helpful, she makes it seems like you have room to be creative and open when writing but don't fall for it (keep in mind she does not give detailed description for assignments, just expects you to know!)

Despite what a lot of people on here are saying, I really enjoyed Dr. Patterson's class! She can be a bit blunt at times which is I think why people don't like her. But I would say that she is much better than a lot of people on here are saying she is. Her lectures are interesting and the readings are easy. Go to class and you will do well!

She gave off very negative energy and her classes were not engaging. She played a lot of videos in class to fill up class time and her feedback on assignments is far and few. She also takes a very long time to return assignments and post grades. She also releases information for assignments very slowly, with a little tidbit each week.
